# Organizational Functions

The organization's functional departments support the operations of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, maintaining a high degree of transparency and accountability, and demonstrating exceptional efficiency and professionalism. To promote public understanding of the HKMA’s policies and work, the HKMA actively engages with the broader community and market participants through traditional and social media, the HKMA website, the HKMA Information Centre, and other channels.

Internally, the Monetary Authority is committed to building a flexible and professional work team, while adhering to strict fiscal discipline and enhancing digital capabilities to respond to changes and ensure the effective implementation of all policies and measures.

# Maintain Transparency

# Media Relations and Social Media Applications

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) maintains close communication with the media to enhance transparency and improve public understanding of its policies and operations. In 2024, the HKMA organized or participated in a total of 207 events, including 14 press conferences, four media briefings, 14 on-site interviews, and 175 other public activities. To raise public awareness of the HKMA's core functions, the HKMA held press conferences and media briefings for local, mainland, and overseas media, covering topics such as tokenization, anti-fraud measures, and initiatives to support small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). Throughout the year, the HKMA also arranged 25 media interviews, issued approximately 600 bilingual press releases, and processed a large number of daily media inquiries.

Mr. Yu Weiwen, CEO, was interviewed live by the media at "Hong Kong Fintech Week 2024."

Mr. Li Dazhi, Vice President, delivered a welcome address at the Household Registration Data Interconnection demonstration day.

Media representatives actively participated in the activities hosted by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority in 2024, particularly the third annual International Financial Leaders Investment Summit. The three-day summit garnered over ten thousand news reports from local, mainland, and international media outlets.

Chairman Yu Wai Man was interviewed live by the media at the "International Financial Leaders Investment Summit 2024."

Mr. Nguyen Quoc Hien, Executive Vice President, hosted a press briefing on the establishment of the "Special Task Force for SME Financing."

Mr. Chen Weimin, Vice President, delivered the opening speech at the "2024 Financial Markets Summit"

To better engage the public, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) maintains six social media platforms – including Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, WeChat, X (formerly Twitter), and YouTube – which boast over 200,000 followers. The HKMA produces creative social media content to raise public awareness of a range of topics and initiatives, such as fraud prevention, fintech, green and sustainable finance, support for small and medium-sized enterprises, and major events organized by the HKMA. The HKMA also livestreams the International Financial Leaders Investment Summit on its social media platforms, fostering public and industry participation.

Sharing creative content on social media helps increase public understanding of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s (HKMA) initiatives and various issues.

# Public Inquiry / Public Queries

The Monetary Authority's public inquiry service provides citizens with an effective channel to enhance their understanding of the Monetary Authority's main functions and operations.

In 2024, the public enquiry service handled a total of 9,594 enquiries (Figure 1), all of which were responded to within the HKMA’s service commitment timeframe (Table 1). Approximately half of these enquiries concerned banking consumer matters, financial infrastructure and bond market development, banking policies and regulations, and banknotes and coins (Figure 2). Common enquiries included the coin collection scheme, bank products and services, retail bond issuance programmes, banking-related guidelines and circulars, and "Faster Payments."

Figure 1: Total Number of Public Inquiries

Figure 2 lists 2024 inquiries categorized by type.

#Publications

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) published its "2023 Annual Report" and "2023 Sustainability Report" this year. The "2023 Sustainability Report" received the Commendation Award in the "Public/Non-Profit Institutions (Large)" category at the Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants' "Best Corporate Governance and ESG Awards 2024." Additionally, the "2023 Annual Report" won a Bronze Award in the "Non-Profit and Charitable Institutions" category at the Hong Kong Management Association's 2024 Best Annual Report Awards.

In 2024, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority regularly updated the "Monthly Financial Data Report No. 1" and published:

- Two issues of the Semi-Annual Report on Monetary and Financial Stability  
- Four issues of the Quarterly Report; and  
- 14 articles from the "Insights" publication.

# Institutional Website

The institution’s website (www.hkma.gov.hk) provides over 73,000 pages of information in English, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese, facilitating public access to the latest information from the HKMA. The website also contains the “Register of Authorized Institutions and Local Representative Offices” and the “Register of Authorized Institution Securities Business Staff” maintained under Section 20 of the Banking Ordinance, as well as the “Register of Licensed Stored Value Facility Operators” maintained under the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance.

Since 2018, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) has been releasing financial data and important information on its website in phases through open application programming interfaces (open APIs). As of the end of 2024, a total of 177 open APIs have been launched on the website in accordance with the original plan. For more detailed information on HKMA's open APIs, please visit the HKMA Open API portal (https://apidocs.hkma.gov.hk).

# Information Center

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority's Information Centre is located on the 55th floor of International Financial Centre Phase 2 and is divided into two sections: an exhibition hall and a library. Its aim is to introduce the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's work to the public and enhance public understanding of monetary and banking matters. The exhibition hall provides an interactive introduction to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's functions, as well as the development of Hong Kong's monetary and banking sectors. It also features reference materials and exhibits for the study of Hong Kong's currency, banking, and financial affairs.

The information center welcomed over 68,000 visitors this year, a 120% increase from 2023. The information center also provided over 570 guided tours for schools and other groups.

The library, located adjacent to the exhibition hall, houses a collection of over 26,000 books, periodicals, and other publications covering topics such as Hong Kong currency, banking, finance, and central banking. The library also maintains the “Register of Approved Institutions and Local Representative Offices” and the “Register of Approved Institutions’ Securities Business Staff” as stipulated in Section 20 of the Banking Ordinance, which are available for public inspection.

Kindergarten students participate in a guided tour at the information center to learn about the design of Hong Kong banknotes.

Information center staff introduced to visitors a mosaic artwork depicting the Victoria Harbour skyline, created using Hong Kong coins.

# Community Liaison and Public Education

To enhance public understanding of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's (HKMA) work, the HKMA has been organizing public education seminars since 1998. To date, the seminars have attracted more than 68,000 participants. In 2024, we held an online seminar that drew over 800 students and teachers from 41 secondary schools. The seminar covered topics including an introduction to the HKMA's functions, the linked exchange rate system, Hong Kong banknotes, fraud prevention, the deposit protection scheme, green finance, and opportunities in the banking industry.

We utilize various channels to reach and educate the public, reminding them how to be smart and responsible financial services consumers. In 2024, our activities collectively attracted over 67,000 citizens to participate.

To support the growing trends of digital payment and a green lifestyle, we are promoting the use of electronic red envelopes through social media and radio broadcasts. We also suggest considering distributing physical red envelopes with New Year banknotes.

Produce an animated short film to promote the use of red envelopes (electronic monetary gifts).

# Anti-Scam Song — "Don't Click Random Links"

To further strengthen anti-fraud efforts, we have launched an anti-fraud song performed by singer Yin Guang and Mr. Ruan Guoheng, Deputy Governor of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, reminding the public to "Don't take fake links as genuine, don't let people deceive you" and to properly safeguard sensitive personal data and credit card information. The effectiveness of the cross-media promotional campaign has been recognized, earning it international acclaim.

Vice President Nguyen Quoc Hung (right) participates in performing the anti-fraud song.

Cross-media promotional campaign enhances public awareness regarding fraud prevention.

# "New Opportunities in Cross-border Wealth Management" TV Short Series

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) has collaborated with a local television station to co-produce a television series titled "Cross-Border Wealth Management: New Opportunities," aiming to help the public better understand the "Cross-Border Wealth Management Pilot Scheme" (the "Cross-Border Wealth Management Link") and the opportunities and convenience it offers to retail investors in cross-border investments. This series uses iconic scenes from five popular Hong Kong films to explain the framework of the Cross-Border Wealth Management Link, investor eligibility requirements, products offered through the Northbound and Southbound channels, risk management, and key considerations for cross-border investments. The series will be promoted through television, digital platforms, and social media.

The short film introduces the "Cross-Border Wealth Management Link" in a humorous and entertaining way.

# All-Hong Kong Wealth Management Showdown

To enhance financial literacy among secondary school students, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) is collaborating with various related organizations to host the “All-Hong Kong Financial Literacy Challenge.” The event is entering its tenth year in 2024, with the theme of “Future Financial Talent,” aiming to enable secondary school students to learn about developments and future trends in innovation, financial technology, and artificial intelligence, as well as to promote sustainable development principles encompassing environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors.

The first part of the competition is an online quiz contest, testing the financial knowledge and understanding of current financial topics among participating students. In 2024, a record high of 32,000 students from 290 secondary schools participated in the online quiz, marking a new milestone. Between 2015 and 2024, approximately 125,000 students from 440 secondary schools participated in the online quiz segment of the competition. The second part of the competition, the "Youth Financial Talent Program," is conducted in a mentorship format, with experienced professionals from various fields serving as mentors to train students for the "Design Thinking Challenge." In 2024, this segment of the competition featured a special addition, the "Greater Bay Area Invitational," aimed at promoting interaction and exchange among students from the Guangdong, Hong Kong, and Macao regions.

Vice President Chen Weimin delivered a welcome address at the championship showdown and encouraged the finalists.

Students participating in the "Youth Financial Talent Program" met with their mentors.

# Tabletop Educational Games

In 2023, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority launched its first financial education board game, "$mart Financial 321," and continued promoting it in 2024 to raise awareness of this original board game and enhance its use as an educational tool. The game allows primary school students to learn about different payment methods, basic financial concepts, financial technology, and cybersecurity through simulated scenarios.

At the community level, we set up a booth at the "Hong Kong Book Fair 2024" and organized workshops during Christmas and Lunar New Year holidays, as well as parent-child workshops at the HKMA office, to further promote financial and money management concepts. Additionally, we arranged school visits for primary students to try out the board games and conducted training workshops to encourage secondary school teachers to use board games as one of the teaching materials in the financial education module of the newly introduced secondary school subject "Citizenship, Economics, and Society." The board games have been recognized by the Education Bureau as one of the outstanding teaching tools and were used as prizes for winning schools in its "Financial Literacy School Incentive Program (2023/24)." In 2024, the HKMA conducted approximately 40 board game workshops, attracting participation from over 3,600 students, parents, teachers, and social workers.

Building on the experience of developing the board game "$mart Wealth Management 321," the Hong Kong Monetary Authority launched the strategy board game "Corporate Green Transformation" and distributed it as a souvenir at the "Hong Kong Book Fair 2024" booth. This is the first board game in Hong Kong to convey knowledge about green finance to students.

We continue to support the work of the Investor Education Council, enhancing the financial literacy and financial management skills of Hong Kong citizens, and will explore further collaboration with various stakeholders to improve the effectiveness of community engagement initiatives.

Promote financial literacy to teachers, students, and parents through board game activities.

# Financial Disclosure

To maintain a high level of transparency, the HKMA adopts international financial disclosure standards applicable to central bank operations, including Hong Kong Financial Reporting Standards and the IMF’s Special Data Dissemination Standard. The Finance Division prepares the Exchange Fund financial statements in accordance with Hong Kong Financial Reporting Standards with the assistance of independent auditors and other accounting professionals. In addition, the HKMA provides detailed disclosure and in-depth analysis of budgetary and expenditure information in its Annual Report (see the section “Budgeting and Financial Control” on pages 193 to 194).

# 意見

茲證明我已審計列載於第209至309頁外匯基金及其附屬公司（「集團」）的財務報表，該等財務報表包括外匯基金及集團於2024年12月31日的資產負債表與截至該日止年度的收支帳目、全面收益表、權益變動表和現金流量表，以及財務報表的附註，包括重大會計政策資料。

我認為，該等財務報表已按照香港會計師公會頒布的《香港財務報告會計準則》真實而中肯地反映外匯基金及集團於2024年12月31日的財務狀況及截至該日止年度的財務表現和現金流量，並已按照行政長官在《外匯基金條例》（第66章）第7條下所發出的指示妥為擬備。

# 意見的基礎

我已按照行政長官在《外匯基金條例》第7條下所發出的指示及審計署的審計準則進行審計。我根據該等準則而須承擔的責任，詳載於本報告「審計師就財務報表審計而須承擔的責任」部分。根據該等準則，我獨立於集團，並已按該等準則履行其他道德責任。我相信，我所獲得的審計憑證是充足和適當地為我的審計意見提供基礎。

# 關鍵審計事項

關鍵審計事項是根據我的專業判斷，對截至2024年12月31日止年度財務報表的審計最為重要的事項。我對整體財務報表進行審計及形成意見時處理了這些事項，而我不會對這些事項提供單獨的意見。

# 按公平值列帳的金融資產及金融負債的估值

請參閱財務報表附註2.5、2.6及37.1。

於2024年12月31日，集團按公平值列帳的金融資產共 39,151.17 億港元，金融負債共 13,862.99 億港元。

86%的該等金融資產及所有該等金融負債的公平值為相同資產或負債於活躍市場的報價（第1級參數），或是以估值方法估計，而所用的參數是以可觀察市場數據為基礎（第2級參數）。

其餘14%的該等金融資產的公平值，是以估值方法估計，而所用的參數並非以可觀察市場數據為基礎（第3級參數）。有關金融資產共5,522.51億港元，主要包括非上市投資基金。

鑑於所涉數額龐大及涉及估計，按公平值列帳的金 融資產及金融負債的估值屬關鍵審計事項。

就按公平值列帳的金融資產及金融負債的估值，審計程序包括：
